data.title: Checklist for New Resident Students
data.meta_description: Calling all new, residential students! Here's a handy checklist for you as you move to college and start living on Bethany's beautiful campus!
data.text:
Before you arrive:

Learn what to bring to campus.

Get acquainted with with Bethany’s Residential Policies.

Find and purchase your textbooks on MyBLC.

Make any necessary changes to your class schedule by contacting the Registrar.

Complete Student Athlete forms (required for participation in NCAA Div III athletics).

Complete the Language Inventory placement exam for Spanish or German.

Review the Student Guidebook.

Get your housing assignment.

Get driving directions and maps for your trip to Bethany.

Check your Bethany e-mail account and the Daily Bulletin for announcements.

When you arrive:

Go to your residence hall.

Get your room key and fob from the Resident Hall Coordinator (RHC) in your res hall.

Check into your room with your Resident Assistant (RA).

Get your Student ID in the library.

Register your vehicle (free; required for all student with a vehicle) and buy a parking permit if you wish to park on campus.

Find your mailbox.

Get your computer connected to the Bethany network.

Jump into Bethany’s Best Week Ever!
